summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary telephonic interview conducted on December 2, 2021, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Associate Warden from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview was part of the OIG's investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The memorandum lists attachments including the interview transcript and related emails.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York is the subject of the OIG investigation.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found unresponsive in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive within his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

events.title: OIG interview of BOP Associate Warden
events.description: The U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary telephonic interview of a Federal Bureau of Prisons Associate Warden regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is part of the official OIG investigation (Case Number: 2019-010614) into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
The interviewed individual was an MCC New York Associate Warden with oversight of the Correctional Services Department on August 10, 2019, the day Epstein was found unresponsive.
The interview was recorded and transcribed on December 2, 2021.
Attachments include a Prisoner Schedule Report for August 9, 2019, and documentation collected in reference to the incident.
The document states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is not to be distributed outside the agency.
